page.title: 01Setting of Marsworth
page.content: PHYSICAL_New Mill has butchers shop and flour mill to south merges into Tring.North, between reservoirs, to Marsworth an agricultural area. Dunstable boat club on Grand Union canal at Pitstone attracts Londoners.East to Pitstone village with large school, closed Church, restored Windmill,Farm museum and large cement works.Steps Hill of Ashridge, part of Ivinghoe Beacon beauty spot is north of Aldbury with Stocks House an exclusive gambling club.West of Aldbury are Cement work's Quarries,the railway cutting, Bulbourne canal Lock gate yard and a Pick_your_own fruit farm. The Tring flight of 7 locks is between Bulbourne and Marsworth.Lower Ickenield Way links Marsworth and Pitstone. The Villages are on the sites of Celtic settlements.Romans and Danes came.
